content:
Sure, here's an updated Project Success Criteria table with additional information:

| Baseline / Cost | Time | Accuracy | Source of Performance Pains |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Time to create report | 1 hour/report | N/A | Manual input of data |
| Accuracy of report | 95% accuracy | N/A | Human error during data entry and analysis |
| Source of Performance Pains | N/A | Manual data input, calculation, and report generation | Inefficient and error-prone manual processes |

Note: The above table lists the current baselines and costs for the time and accuracy of report creation, as well as the source of performance pains. These will be used to evaluate the success of the project, which aims to reduce the time and effort required to generate appraisal reports, improve the accuracy and quality of appraisal reports, and increase efficiency in the appraisal process.
